snippet: Texas requires a government ID to vote. A federal court can end the state’s politically motivated discriminatory measure.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Texas and 10 other Republican-controlled states for imposing a government ID requirement to vote, contending that the laws are meant to dissuade poor and minority voters who tend to vote Democratic; urges panel of federal judges in Texas to invalidate the state's requirement under the Voting Rights Act of 1965, which allows the Justice Department to disapprove of any change in voting procedures in areas with a history of discrimination.
lead_paragraph: Texas requires a government ID to vote. A federal court can end the state’s politically motivated discriminatory measure.

headline.seo: Voter IDs on Trial in Texas
